body_html:
You'd want to structure your code so that each iteration feeds a minibatch instead of hardcoding the input in the call to loss.

See for example the custom training tutorial and other tutorial notebooks on www.tensorflow.org/tutorials and the MNIST example

Hope that helps!
body_text:
You'd want to structure your code so that each iteration feeds a minibatch instead of hardcoding the input in the call to loss.
See for example the custom training tutorial and other tutorial notebooks on www.tensorflow.org/tutorials and the MNIST example
Hope that helps!
body:
You'd want to structure your code so that each iteration feeds a minibatch instead of hardcoding the input in the call to `loss`. 

See for example the [custom training tutorial](https://colab.research.google.com/github/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/eager/python/examples/notebooks/custom_training.ipynb) and other tutorial notebooks on www.tensorflow.org/tutorials and the [MNIST example](https://github.com/tensorflow/models/blob/master/official/mnist/mnist_eager.py)

Hope that helps!
